frameDefinitions: Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world.
An Agent, Situation or Entity has an influence on a Cognizer.
This frame describes the process that involves the inquiry and determination by an authority, the Investigator, of the circumstances surrounding an Incident perpetrated by a Suspect.
An Entity changes from one kind of thing (Initial_category) to another kind of thing (Final_category).
This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication.
A Cognizer introduces a New_idea into society.
frameExamples: Later that night, they <t>found</t> the barely-alive victim inside the Red Hall estate flat.
These works had a profound effect and <t>influenced</t> her in the creation of a successful series capturing this sun-drenched region.
The police are <t>investigating</t> the bank's reported loss of several thousand dollars from their downtown branch's top security vault. DNI
She <t>metamorphosed</t> from a mere coworker into a friend .
Evelyn was <t>candid</t> with me about the party.
It is difficult to imagine how different our lives would be without Edison's <t>invention</t> of the light bulb.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who becomes aware of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
Thm <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:
This role identifes the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Topic</fen> indicates the general field within which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is found.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> uses an <fen>Instrument</fen> to (enable themselves to) become aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.  In some cases, the <fen>Instrument</fen> may appear in subject position.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The person who is influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
A state of affairs--- which can be an event, state or conditions---that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
A person or thing that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
An Action that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides to carry out as a consequence of the influence of a <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
A <fen>Behavior</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is engaged in independently but whose execution is subsequently influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
An entity that stands metonymically for the actions and considerations that produced it.
The <fen>Agent</fen> acts to influence a <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the Subjective_influencing event occurs.
The location in which one has influence.
The <fen>Investigator</fen> is the person or agency that investigates the <fen>Suspect</fen> of a crime (<fen>Incident</fen>).

The <fen>Investigator</fen> attempts to determine the exact circumstances surrounding the <fen>Incident</fen>, which is typically a criminal act (murder, robbery) or the result of such an act (death, loss of money).
This role denotes the <fen>Suspect</fen> that is investigated by the <fen>Investigator</fen>.
When the <fen>Investigator</fen> investigates the <fen>Incident</fen>.
The concrete or abstract entity that undergoes a change.
The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that results from the change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to before it undergoes the change.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the transformation.
The location that the change takes place.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>, the truth or sincerity of which is at issue. It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word, or as the Nominal Head of prenominal uses.

<fen>Message</fen> is the communicative content whose truth or sincerity is at issue. This role does not normally co-occur with the other FEs in this frame. When it does occur, it is normally the External Argument of a predicative use of the <t>Target</t> word, or the modified Nominal Head in a prenominal use.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It often occurs without the <fen>Message</fen> role in predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes up with or conceptualizes the <fen>New_idea</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument:
The <fen>New_idea</fen> is a concept not previously present in society which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> introduces.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes up with the <fen>New_idea</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes up with the <fen>New_idea</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> discovered a great little restaurant in Soho.
Pat discovered <fex>a great little restaurant</fex> in Soho.
<fex>By opening the book to page 10</fex>, you will find the Van Eerdens' number.
Scientists attempt to make discoveries <fex>about the laws of nature</fex>.
Olson says the deputy came out to the farm and detected a radioactive substance <fex>with his Geiger counter</fex>.
Robbie had wondered if they would be able to find the path <fex>at night</fex>.
George Gilder would run with this idea later in writing the New Testament of supply-side economics that influenced <fex>Reagan</fex>.
<fex>The balmy temperatures</fex> inspired me to write a poem on the advent of spring.
<fex>The painting</fex> inspired me to take a risk and use the intense green for the sky.
What factors influenced Nixon <fex>to issue the doctrine</fex>?
Attention will also be paid to St. Paul , what influenced him <fex>in his thinking</fex> and what he wrote in his letters about sex, sexuality, men and women
Does anyone know what inspired <fex>this song</fex>?
Chavez has much influence <fex>in South America</fex>.
The police are investigating <fex>Dr. Phil</fex>.
Our guys are <fex>currently</fex> investigating her disappearance.
How pleasing to see that <fex>Scranton</fex> has metamorphosed .
His smile transformed <fex>into a frown</fex> .
The viccar converted <fex>from a professional clergyman</fex> into an anti-ecclesiastical activist.
<fex>Then</fex> she turned into a lizard.
<fex>Evelyn</fex> was candid about the party.
Evelyn made some candid <fex>remarks</fex>.
Evelyn was candid <fex>about the party</fex>.
Evelyn made some candid remarks <fex>in French</fex>.
<fex>Kim Sung</fex> invented cinnamon cheez fries in 1988.
The strong gravitic shield was discovered <fex>in 2162</fex>.
Was the light bulb invented <fex>in Austria</fex>?

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Civil War Combat: Reality and Myth
